FuncDef:
The bfr-prefix command configures a BFR-prefix in a BIER subdomain.
The undo bfr-prefix command restores the default configuration.
By default, no BFR-prefix is configured in a BIER subdomain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a BFR-prefix in a BIER subdomain, run the bfr-prefix command. A BIER-prefix is equivalent to a router ID and is used to flood BIER TLV information. To establish a BIER tunnel, ensure that BIER-prefixes are not aggregated or conflict.
Prerequisites
A BIER subdomain has been configured using the sub-domain command.
